column4: hm, im at a friend, she did just an update. and rebooted. and now she lost the UUID of her / partition
don't suggest that here, thank you
that neither, you don't tell others to just 'search <url>'
and im just iritated that a upgrade can let your machine loose UUID's this is the second time it happens here
i understand, but still you can't tell others just to google it.

i dont know, this person just said by him/herself that he/she didnt search yet. so then its just odd to ask immediatly. i remember when i started 12 years ago with my debian installation. then im still nice now :)
fair enough, but channel guidelines are clear on just suggesting google (or other search engines)
you got the UUID change/removal fixed?
no, i just get in the initrd CLI
but i think i should try a fsckfs maybe
just came up in my head. it might that the partition superblock or something broke. is the only thing that would make sense to me
I really have no clue as to why UUID is (seems to have) gone, but you can alway add it again
boot from livecd and fix the filesystems
thats what i was thinking about now yes. but strange thing is that this is the 2nd time after updating. i was wondering if that question came here before. of its a dual-boot btw
currently checking the bugspages, but not finding anything relevant
just searched for hours too already yes, just doesnt make sense at all
